text: Robert Marshall Blount Fulford (February 13, 1932 - October 15, 2024) was a Canadian journalist, magazine editor, and essayist. He was born in Ottawa, Ontario. He was a columnist for The Toronto Star from the 1950s to the 1970s. From 1963 to 1964 he was a columnist and editor of the Reviews section at Maclean's magazine. Fulford died on October 15, 2024 at a care facility from problems caused by vascular dementia in Toronto, Ontario at the age of 92.Robert Fulford, renowned journalist and longtime National Post columnist, dead at 92 ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Canadian journalists Category:Canadian essayists Category:Canadian editors Category:Writers from Ontario Category:People from Ottawa Category:Deaths from vascular dementia
title: Robert Fulford (journalist)
